title: Can a body vibrate without making a sound? - Quora

response.answer_text: To make a sound the vibrating body must vibrate at a frequency in the audible frequency range (roughly 50 - 10,000 times per second) and also must make the air around it vibrate at the same or a related frequency. If the body vibrates more slowly or more rapidly, or if it doesn’t make the air vibrate, it won’t make a sound.
Yes, If it vibrates in vacuum, or if it vibrates in a frequency either below 20 Hz or above 20 kHz, which are the lower and upper limits of the human hearing range. Hearing range - Wikipedia
